_header: This book is one and Gods curse is another
_description: A common medieval bookplate — one couplet

OxfStJohn76.Transcription:
Thys boke ys on crystys curs ys A nodyrHe that sstellyth the ton I
                    pray good send hym þe todyrquod Iohannes Wryghtson
OxfStJohn76.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 85.

BLAdd30506.Transcription: This boke ys one & christ curse a noþerhe þat take þe one take þe oþer

BLHar1251.Transcription: thys boke ys one and godes kors ys anoderthey that take the ton god gef them the toder
BLHar1251.Editions:
Wanley,  Humphrey. 
             A Catalogue of the Harleian Manuscripts in the British Museum.
         4 vols. London: Eyre and Strahan, 1808-12; ed. Wanley et al: 1.635.
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 2.163.
Bennett,  Henry Stanley. 
             England from Chaucer to Caxton.
         London: Methuen, 1928: 161.
Coulton,  George Gordon. 
             Life in the Middle Ages.
         Cambridge: at the UP, 1931, and New York: Macmillan, 1931: 2.118 (modernized).
Sisam,  Celia,  and  Kenneth Sisam, eds.  
             The Oxford Book of Medieval English Verse.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1970: 563-4.

BLHar2320.Transcription: Thys Booke is owne thyng & godis Covrys is AnothereHe that Stelys the owne thyng I pray god send heme the othere
BLHar2320.Note: Added to flyleaf by a later hand.
BLHar2320.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 2320.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?index=0&ref=Harley_MS_2320.
BLHar2320.Editions:
Wordsworth,  Charles,  and  Henry Littlehales.  
             The Old Service Books of the English Church.
         London: 1904: 60.

VandAReid44.Transcription:
This boke ys oon the curse of crist ys a nothirHe that stelith thoon
                    shall haue the othir
VandAReid44.Note:
Hamer (1995)
XHamer,  Richard. 
             A Manuscript Index to the Index of Middle English Verse.
         London: British Library, 1995 notes, ‘not found’. Transcription
                    from the Burlington Magazine 1 (Mar-May 190).
VandAReid44.Editions:
“New Acquisitions at the National Museums: Victoria And Albert Museum:
                The Reid Gift—I.” 
             Burlington Magazine
         1 (Mar-May 1903): 389-90 plus plate facing 389: 390.

HunHM140.Transcription:
Thys Boke hys whon & crystes cors hys a nodorhe that steles they
                    boke thake they thodor
HunHM140.Editions:
Manly,  John Matthews. 
             Specimens of the Pre-Shakspearean Drama.
         2 vols. Boston: Ginn, 1897: 1.436.
